```{r experiment}

#Protists

protist_species = c("Ble", "Cep", "Col", "Eug", "Eup", "Lox", "Pau", "Pca", "Spi", "Spi_te", "Tet")
n_protist_species = length(protist_species)
first_protist = protist_species[1]
last_protist = protist_species[n_protist_species]

#Patches

culture_info = read.csv(here("data", "PatchSizePilot_culture_info.csv"), header = TRUE)
n_cultures = max(culture_info$culture_ID)
eco_metaeco_types = unique(culture_info$eco_metaeco_type)
ecosystems_to_take_off = 60 #Culture ID = 60 because it was spilled (isolated small patch, high disturbance, system nr = 40)

#Meta-ecosystems

system_nr_metaecosystems = culture_info %>%
  filter(metaecosystem == "yes") %>%
  pull(system_nr) %>%
  unique

n_metaecosystems = length(system_nr_metaecosystems)

metaecosystems_to_take_off = culture_info %>%
  filter(culture_ID %in% ecosystems_to_take_off) %>%
  pull(system_nr) %>%
  unique

#Sampling

time_point_names = c("t0", "t1", "t2", "t3", "t4", "t5", "t6", "t7")
sampling_days = c(0, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28)
first_time_point = 0
last_time_point = length(sampling_days) - 1
n_time_points = last_time_point + 1
nr_videos = c(12,1,1,1,1,1,2,2) #Videos taken for each time point for each culture. At t0 we took 12 videos of the large bottle from which we started the  cultures.
n_videos_taken_t0 = nr_videos[1]

time_point_day = data.frame(
  time_point = first_time_point:last_time_point,
  day = sampling_days
)

#Resource flow
resource_flow_days = c(5, 9, 13, 17, 21, 25)
first_resource_flow = resource_flow_days[1]
```

```{r}
#Define the variables whose effect size I want to calculate
vars = c("bioarea_per_ml",
         "indiv_per_ml",
         "species_richness",
         "shannon",
         "evenness_pielou",
         protist_species,
         paste0(protist_species, "_dominance"))

#Define the variables I want to calculate but for meta-ecosystems
vars_metaecos = c(
  "total_metaecosystem_bioarea",
  "jaccard_index",
  "bray_curtis",
  "metaecosystem_richness"
)
```
